Method Detail

Transaction

public int Transaction(java.lang.String Request,
                       int RequestLen,
                       int UTI,
                       byte[] Reply,
                       int ReplyBufLen,
                       java.lang.StringBuffer ReplyLen,
                       java.lang.String IPAddress,
                       int Port,
                       int ReadTimeout)
Deprecated. Replaced by byte[] transact(int, byte[], String, int, int) and adminATOM(byte[], String, int, int)

Sends a request through ATOM to the FedEx API Gateway and receives the response.

Parameters:
Request - String containing the transaction
RequestLen - unused
UTI - integer representing the Universal Transaction Identifier; ignored for ATOM admin transactions
Reply - byte array in which the reply will be returned
ReplyBufLen - integer indicating the length of Reply byte array
ReplyLen - StringBuffer in which the actual length of the reply is returned as a decimal integer
IPAddress - hostname or IP address of ATOM
Port - one of the listening ports of ATOM; for API transactions, it should equal ATOM's port for such transactions (typically 8190) as set in the [ATOM_MACHINE] section of ATOM's config.ini; for ATOM admin transactions, it should equal 8189 or the value most recently set with the SetAtomAdminPort() method, which should equal the admin port number as set in the [ATOM_SYSTEM] section of ATOM's config.ini
ReadTimeout - API read timeout in seconds; controls how long the API will wait for a response from ATOM

SetAtomAdminPort

public int SetAtomAdminPort(int PortNum)
Deprecated. No replacement

Informs the API of what ATOM's admin port is. The API recognizes that a request passed in a Transaction() call is an ATOM admin request by the fact that the port number passed in the Transaction() call equals the ATOM admin port. If ATOM's admin port in its config.ini file has been changed from the default value of 8189 to some other value, this method must be called with the correct port number to inform the API of what the ATOM admin port is prior to making any Transaction() call with an ATOM admin request.
The value passed in here will stored in a class variable, and so it will persist across all instances of the FedExAPI class, so it need not be called again on other instances. In other words, this method should be treated as though it were a static (class) method. If different ATOMs are to be addressed by different calls to Transaction(), this method must be called by some instance of the FedExAPI class between those calls. It is inadvisable to attempt to have multiple concurrently running instances of the FedExAPI class attempt to address different ATOMs with different admin ports.

adminATOM

public static byte[] adminATOM(byte[] request,
                               java.lang.String host,
                               int port,
                               int readTimeout)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                               FedExAPIException
Sends an administrative request to ATOM and returns the response. Note that this function is static. You need not instantiate the FedExAPI class in order to call this function.

Parameters:
request - the admin request
host - the hostname or address of the instance of ATOM to be administered
port - the admin port of that ATOM, as set in the [ATOM_SYSTEM] section of that ATOM's config.ini file
readTimeout - the time in seconds after which the API will timeout when attempting to read the response from ATOM
Returns:
the response
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
FedExAPIException

transact

public static byte[] transact(int UTI,
                              byte[] request,
                              java.lang.String host,
                              int port,
                              int readTimeout)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              FedExAPIException
Sends an API request through ATOM and returns the response. Note that this function is static. You need not instantiate the FedExAPI class in order to call this function.

Parameters:
UTI - Universal Transaction Identifier of request
request - the request
host - the hostname or address of the instance of ATOM to which request is to be sent
port - the port on which that ATOM will be listening, as set in its config.ini file
readTimeout - the time in seconds after which the API will timeout when attempting to read the response from ATOM
Returns:
the response
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
FedExAPIException
